alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Nowata; Osage; Ottawa; Rogers; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 3:02AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Craig, northeastern Rogers, northwestern Delaware, northeastern Osage, Ottawa, northwestern Mayes, northern Washington and Nowata Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 302 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles south of Chautauqua to 12 miles north of New Alluwe to 3 miles southeast of Adair. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Bartlesville... Miami... Vinita... Baxter Springs... Nowata... Grove... Dewey... Commerce... Chelsea... Fairland... Afton... Quapaw... Adair... South Coffeyville... Copan... Welch... Bernice... Ketchum... Delaware... Bluejacket... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 264 and 324. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Nowata; Osage; Ottawa; Rogers; Washington
